plan: I will start by assessing my value for the prize each round. In the first round, I'll adopt an aggressive strategy, bidding up to my full value to gauge competitors' behavior. In the second round, I'll test a conservative approach, exiting early to observe others' thresholds. In the final round, I'll implement a balanced strategy, adjusting my bids based on insights from previous rounds. I'll focus on identifying patterns in Betty's and Charles' bidding strategies, aiming to optimize my long-term profit by strategically outbidding them without exceeding my value.

In the first round, I'll bid aggressively up to 75% of my value to gather data on competitors' strategies. In the second round, I'll apply a moderate strategy, bidding up to 60% of my value to balance risk and reward. In the final round, I'll adapt based on previous rounds: if competitors bid high, I'll be more aggressive; if they bid low, I'll be conservative. Throughout, I'll monitor when others exit to fine-tune my approach. This adaptive strategy aims to maximize profit by leveraging insights from competitor behavior and value distribution.

In the next three rounds, I'll employ varied strategies to maximize long-term profit. In Round 1, I'll bid aggressively if my value exceeds 25, testing opponents' thresholds. In Round 2, I'll bid conservatively, stopping at half my value to assess competitors' strategies and price sensitivity. In Round 3, I'll adapt based on previous rounds: if others bid high, I'll push near my value; if they bid low, I'll stop slightly above the average winning bid from earlier rounds. This approach balances risk and data collection, optimizing future profitability by understanding opponent behavior.

In the final round, I'll bid strategically, starting at 4 to observe Betty's and Charles' responses. I'll adjust dynamically, aiming to exit at 6 if competition is strong. This approach balances risk and profit, leveraging insights from previous rounds to optimize my long-term gain.

In this final round, I'll bid up to 75% of my value if others bid high, adapting aggressively. If they bid low, I'll cap at 50% to conserve profit potential. Monitor exit points closely for strategic insights, aiming to win with a positive profit.
